content:
• Thursday, February 9, 2017
  • QUOT

    Quotient Technology revenues beat for fifth straight quarter

    • Quotient Technology (QUOT +4.3%) grew sales nearly 9% and beat revenue expectations for the fifth quarter in a row in its Q4 results.
    • EBITDA rose 51% to $11.3M, beating analyst expectations for $6.6M. On a GAAP basis, the company swung to a gain of $3.5M vs. a year-ago loss of $3.6M.
    • Total transactions for the quarter rose 47% to 691M.
    • The company also has added two new members to the board: Scott Raskin (CEO of Spigit) and Mir Aamir (Quotient's president and chief operating officer).
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenue of $70M-$73M (vs. consensus for $73.2M), and EBITDA of $6.5M-$7.5M (light of consensus for $8.2M). For full 2017, it sees revenue of $307M-$317M (vs. consensus for $309.4M) and EBITDA of $40M-$45M (vs. consensus for $43.7M).
    • Shares are up 10.1% in thin trading after hours.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 PM
  • VSAT

    ViaSat profits flatten out in Q3 report

    • ViaSat (VSAT +3.1%) saw revenue grow nearly 10% but profits stayed flat in fiscal Q3 earnings.
    • EBITDA came to $83.9M, down 2.4% and missing an expected $87.8M.
    • Profits in satellite services and government services were more than offset by wider losses at its Commercial Networks segment. The company notes R&D expenses there were up 93%, tied mainly to developing the ViaSat-3 payloads and next-gen networks.
    • Revenues by segment: Satellite services, $160.1M (up 13.4%); Commercial Networks, $54.5M (down 1.7%); Government Systems, $166M (up 9.9%).
    • EBITDA by segment: Satellite services, $76.6M (up 20.6%); Commercial Networks, -$32.6M vs. year-ago -$14.9M; Government Systems, $39.9M (up 7%).
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:58 PM
  • INFN

    Infinera +8.51%; Q4 2016 above expectations

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $181M (vs. $260M Y/Y, consensus $175.37M), EPS -$0.12 ($0.01 above estimates), gross margin 41.8% (vs. 48.3% Y/Y), operating margin -9.2% (vs. 12.7% Y/Y), net loss $17M (vs. $32M net income Y/Y)
    • Infinera CEO Tom Fallon: "We executed well in the fourth quarter and delivered results at the high-end of our guidance. As network infrastructures rapidly evolve, our objective remains to help our customers win by delivering the highest performing solutions at the Transport Layer. Though our product transition is currently holding back revenue growth and profitability, by introducing next generation ICE4 products, my belief is that we are well positioned to begin improving our business results over the course of 2017 and for significant opportunities in the future."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:INFN) $10.20
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM | 4 Comments
  • ONVO

    Organovo FQ3 revenues more than triple but softer revenue guidance sinks shares, down 16% after hours

    • Organovo (NASDAQ:ONVO) fiscal Q3 results ($M): Total Revenues: 1.2 (+250.9%); Product & Services: 699 (+138.6%).
    • Net Loss: (9.6) (8.3%); Loss/Share: (0.09) (+9.1%); CF Ops (9 mo.): (27.8) (+8.0%).
    • 2017 Guidance: Total Revenues: $3.7M - 4.5M from $4.5M - 6.2M.
    • CEO Keith Murphy says, “We’re revising our total revenue guidance for fiscal 2017 because of a change in the timing of customer orders due to specific customer requests for additional validation studies related to certain use cases and for qualification of an additional cell source.  We expect to successfully complete the additional scientific studies required to address these issues, and don’t anticipate these items will have a long-term impact on customer adoption.  The required studies will delay a portion of our forecasted revenue into fiscal 2018.  We’re working diligently with our customers to complete the technical work and to unlock both existing backlog and prospective orders, and look ahead with confidence to continued growth in our pipeline."
    • Shares are off 16% after hours on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 7 Comments
  • NWS

    News Corp. shares gain amid promising growth in real estate, books

    • News Corp. (NWS +2.4%, NWSA +1.9%) A shares are up 1.6% after hours after the release of in-line fiscal Q2 results where its revenues fell 2% against a negative currency-exchange impact, but profits jumped in segments outside its base News and Information Services.
    • EBITDA rose to $325M from $280M, and beat an expected $287M. Revenues excluding currency and acquisitions/divestitures fell 1%.
    • A decline in ad revenues in News and Information Services was only partially offset by growth in Digital Real Estate Services and Book Publishing.
    • Revenue by segment: News and Information Services, $1.303B (down 7%); Book Publishing, $466M (up 4%); Digital Real Estate Services, $242M (up 16%); Cable Network Programming, $104M (down 2%).
    • EBITDA by segment: News and Information Services, $142M (down 10%); Book Publishing, $75M (up 32%); Digital Real Estate Services, $95M (up 30%); Cable Network Programming, $51M (up 31%).
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • HDP

    Hortonworks +4.23%; Q4 2016 over expectations, projections in line or better

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $51.96M (+38.9% Y/Y, $3.93M above estimates), EPS -$0.50 ($0.10 above estimates)
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $52M (consensus $52.07M), operating margin -65% to -60%
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $235M-$240M (consensus $234.67M), operating margin -50% to -45%
    • Hortonworks CEO and chairman of the board of directors Rob Bearden: "Our fourth quarter performance was highlighted by double-digit growth in support subscription revenue, clearly showing continued strong market demand for our open source platforms. The combination of enterprise customers' accelerating business transformations fueled by data and our continued financial discipline positions Hortonworks extremely well for growth and success in 2017."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:HDP) $10.60
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM

  • CYBR

    CyberArk -3.43%; Q4 2016 above expectations, EPS forecasts below

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $64.4M (+25.1% Y/Y, $1.39M above estimates), EPS $0.41 ($0.08 above estimates), operating income $19.4M (vs. $15.2M Y/Y), net income $14.7M (vs. $13.8M Y/Y)
    • Revenues – License $40.8M (+23% Y/Y), Maintenance and Professional Services $23.6M (+28% Y/Y)
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $57M-$58M (+22%-24% Y/Y; consensus $57.7M), EPS $0.21-$0.23 (consensus $0.27), operating income $9.9M-$10.7M
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $267M-$270M (+23%-25% Y/Y; consensus $263.98), EPS $1.20-$1.24 (consensus $1.34), operating income $56M-$58M
    • CyberArk chairman and CEO Udi Mokady: "CyberArk had an incredible 2016. We outperformed across revenue, operating income and net income per share, demonstrating the ongoing execution of our land and expand strategy and the power of our operating model. Protecting privileged accounts, across the enterprise, on endpoints, in the cloud and in hybrid environments, is increasingly recognized as fundamental to cyber security programs. Because of our operational and financial success in 2016, we entered 2017 as an even stronger company, well positioned to continue to deliver profitable revenue growth."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:CYBR) $53.43
    • Conference call
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 7 Comments
  • DRWI

    DragonWave jumps 11.4% as it updates results of warrant exercises

    • DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI), up 12.9% today on nearly 10 times normal volume, is up another 11.4% after hours following an update on its share count.
    • The company says it has 7,305,012 common shares outstanding after the exercise of six-month warrants that were issued in an August public offering.
    • Those warrants had their exercise price cut from $4/share to $1.50 a share a couple of weeks ago, a move that pressured the stock.
    • Gross proceeds were $1.8M; the company will use the net proceeds for general purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM | 10 Comments
  • NE

    Noble Corp beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Noble Corp (NYSE:NE): Q4 EPS of -$0.15 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $410.2M (-52.2% Y/Y) beats by $19.27M.
    • Shares +1.2% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM | 44 Comments
  • P

    Pandora Media -2.8% after earnings report features light Q1 guidance

    • Pandora Media (P -2.4%) is another 2.8% lower in late trading following the release of Q4 results that beat analyst expectations but featured light Q1 guidance and showed listener hours that fell sequentially for the second quarter in a row, despite some expected seasonal strength.
    • "We made significant progress in 2016 by driving leverage in our core business while accelerating subscriptions to our paid product," says CEO/founder Tim Westergren, who adds the company's now "laser-focused" on growing ad-supported business and launching subscription products and an artist-to-fan platform.
    • Listener hours were up 0.4% Y/Y to 5.38B. Active listeners dropped to 81M from the prior year's 81.1M. Subscribers rose 12% to 4.39M.
    • In new metrics, average revenue per paid subscriber was $4.73, and licensing costs per paid subscriber came to $3.12. The new metrics replace subscription RPM and LPM.
    • For Q1, the company's guiding to revenue of $310M-$320M (light of consensus for $344.4M), and adjusted EBITDA of -$80M to -$70M (below expectations for -$58.9M). For the full year, it's guiding to revenues of $1.55B-$1.7B (vs. $1.677B consensus); it declined to guide on full-year EBITDA as it's "managing towards full year 2017 adjusted EBITDA profitability."
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia -2.05%; Q4 2017, revenue outlook over estimates

    • Q4 2017 results – revenue $2.17B (+55% Y/Y, $60M above estimates), EPS $1.13 ($0.30 above estimates), gross margin 60.2% (+300 bps Y/Y), operating expense $498M (+12% Y/Y), operating income $809M (+127% Y/Y), net income $704M (+137% Y/Y)
    • Capital return – Expects to return $1.25B to shareholders through dividends and repurchases in FY 2018. Next quarterly dividend of $0.14 per share payable March 17, 2017 to shareholders of record February 24, 2017.
    • Q1 2018 projections – revenue $1.9B (+/- 2%; consensus $1.88B), gross margin 59.7% (+/- 50 bps), operating expenses $520M, other income and expense, net $4M, tax rate 17% (+/- 1%), capital expenditures $50M-$60M
    • Nvidia founder and CEO Jen-Hsun Huang: "We had a great finish to a record year, with continued strong growth across all our businesses. Our GPU computing platform is enjoying rapid adoption in artificial intelligence, cloud computing, gaming, and autonomous vehicles. Deep learning on NVIDIA GPUs, a breakthrough approach to AI, is helping to tackle challenges such as self-driving cars, early cancer detection and weather prediction. We can now see that ‎GPU-based deep learning will revolutionize major industries, from consumer internet and transportation to health care and manufacturing. The era of AI is upon us."
    • Takeaway – With Nvidia shares higher by 9% since the start of the year following a torrid end-of-2016 run (+55% from November 1 through December 30; robust Q3 2017), the after hours sell-off is of moderate level despite the headline (earnings call forthcoming) confidence.
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:NVDA) $114
    • Quarterly revenue trend
    • CFO commentary
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 49 Comments
  • PNNT

    PennantPark Investment continues run after inline quarter, gain in NAV

    • FQ1 net investment income of $15M or $0.21 per share vs. $15.2M and $0.21 in FQ4, and $16.8M and $0.23 one year ago. Distributions of $0.28 in FQ4, but will be cut to $0.18 in the March quarter (old news).
    • Net asset value per share of $9.11 up from $9.05 three months earlier.
    • Dial-in conference call tomorrow at 10 ET.
    • Previously: PennantPark Investment NII in-line, beats on total investment income (Feb. 8)
    • PNNT +1% after hours. Those who bought the big dip after FQ4's rough report and the announcement of a dividend cut continue to be amply rewarded - shares are higher by 18% since.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 1 Comment

  • YELP

    Yelp slips 8.4% after Q4 report holds downbeat guidance

    • Yelp (NYSE:YELP) is off 7.7% in after-hours trading following the release of Q4 results that edged expectations but featured light guidance for the current quarter.
    • Revenue grew 26.7% to $194.8M; of that, local revenue grew 36% to $171.1M.
    • Meanwhile, transactions revenue rose 19% to $16.6M, and other revenue grew 4% to $7.1M.
    • Cumulative reviews were up 27% Y/Y, to about 121M, and app unique devices grew 20% to about 24M (monthly average).
    • For Q1 the company is guiding to revenue of $195M-$199M -- growth of about 25% Y/Y but light of an expected $204.4M. Adjusted EBITDA is forecast at $25M-$28M vs. $30.2M consensus.
    • For full 2017, it's forecasting net revenue of $880M-$900M (vs. consensus for $895.8M) and EBITDA of $150M-$165M (vs. an expected $163.7M).
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 21 Comments
  • SKX

    Skechers higher after revenue growth impresses

    • Skechers (NYSE:SKX) topped Q4 revenue estimates with both the international wholesale and global retail sides of the business generating double-digit sales growth in the quarter,
    • Gross profit improved 100 bps to 46.6% of sales.
    • SG&A expenses fell back 20 bps to 7.8% of sales.
    • The company ended the quarter with an inventory position of $700.5M, up 13% Y/Y.
    • Skechers expects revenue of $1.05B-$1.075B in Q1 vs. $1.04B consensus and EPS of $0.50 to $0.55.
    • Previously: Skechers misses by $0.05, beats on revenue (Feb. 9)
    • SKX +6.74% AH to $24.85.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 16 Comments
  • ATVI

    Activision Blizzard +8.9% on earnings with raised dividend, buyback

    • Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI) has jumped 8.9% after hours following record Q4 results that came alongside a boosted dividend and buyback.
    • Earnings beat the company's own outlook and beat consensus. But Activision Blizzard increased its cash dividend by 15%, to $0.30/share, and authorized a $1B stock repurchase plan.
    • Revenue breakout: Product sales, $696M (down 2.1%); Subscription, licensing and other, $1.318B (up 105%).
    • The company noted 447M monthly active users for the quarter; Blizzard had record Q4 MAUs of 41M, and Overwatch became Blizzard's fastest game ever to reach 25M players globally. Activision, meanwhile, had 51M Q4 MAUs and King had 355M MAUs -- down Y/Y "but with better per-user engagement and investment."
    • For Q1, it's guiding to net revenues of $1.55B on a GAAP basis and EPS of $0.25.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 12 Comments

    Cliffs Natural Resources to launch 50M-share offering

    • Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF) -4.5% AH after commencing a public offering of 50M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 7.5M shares.
    • CLF plans to use part of the proceeds to fund the purchase of outstanding senior notes, with remaining proceeds for general corporate purposes, including the redemption of some of its outstanding senior secured notes and/or the repurchase of additional tender notes.
    • CLF shares soared nearly 20% in today's trade following better than expected Q4 earnings.

  • CX

    Cemex jumps nearly 3% after strong Q4 concludes record 2016

    • Cemex (CX +2.7%) is higher after reporting better than expected Q4 earnings in wrapping up the Mexican company's biggest full-year profit since 2007.
    • CX says Q4 EBITDA rose 1% Y/Y to $654M and climbed 10% on a comparable basis; sales fell 4% to $3.2B, down 4% Y/Y but up 4% when adjusted for local currency losses against the U.S. dollar and for asset sales.
    • In today's earnings conference call, CEO Fernando Gonzalez said CX expects 2017 capex of $730M and 1%-3% growth in cement and concrete volumes.
    • CX shares have rallied since the U.S. presidential election, partly on hopes that the company could benefit from Pres. Trump's plan to build a wall along the U.S.-Mexico border; Gonzalez declined to comment on the subject in today's earnings conference call.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 4 Comments
  • UFS

    Lower selling prices clip results at Domtar

    • A Q4 earnings miss sends shares of Domtar (UFS -4.2%) lower.
    • The company cites lower average selling prices as a drag during the quarter.
    • Looking ahead, Domtar says it expects paper shipments to be in-line with market demand this year and pulp shipments to be higher due to the conversion of a paper machine to a fluff pulp line.
    • Previously: Domtar misses by $0.20, misses on revenue (Feb. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • SEE

    Sealed Air -6.5% after downside 2017 earnings guidance

    • Sealed Air (SEE -6.6%) sinks after reporting better than expected Q4 earnings but guiding FY 2017 earnings below consensus.
    • SEE now expects FY 2017 EPS of ~$2.70 vs. $2.97 analyst consensus estimate, with net sales essentially unchanged Y/Y, assuming a ~3% unfavorable impact of from foreign currency translation; adjusted for unfavorable currency, net sales in 2017 would increase by ~2.5%.
    • SEE also confirms it is exploring other strategic alternatives, including a potential sale of New Diversey, in addition to the already announced plan to pursue a tax-free spin-off of New Diversey.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • APPS

    Digital Turbine +2.8% after narrower-than-expected loss

    • A beat of profit expectations in fiscal Q3 has lifted nanocap Digital Turbine (NASDAQ:APPS), now up 2.8%.
    • The company's loss of $0.04/share was narrower than expected and narrower than a year ago (loss of $0.11/share, $7.3M in total), though revenues that fell 7.5% missed slightly.
    • Revenue by segment: Advertising, $16.2M (down 7%); Content, $6.1M (down 9%).
    • Within Advertising, Operators & OEMs revenue (including Ignite, Discover and other professional ad services) was a record $11.8M (up 70% Y/Y), and Advertisers & Publishers revenue (includes former Appia Core) was $4.4M (down 58% Y/Y).
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • TWTR

    Twitter downgraded to Underperform at Cowen and Company, Raymond James

    • Cowen and Company recalculates from Market Perform, attributing Twitter's steeply lower forecasts on the near-term, heightened competitive challenges and strategic uncertainty. Target from $15 to $12.
    • Raymond James notes an increasingly challenging advertising environment leading to greater competition, as well as relatively uninspiring MAU growth despite positive DAU gains. Considers fair value $10, downgrades from Market Perform.
    • Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) $16.38, -12.47%.
    • Earlier (February 9, 2017): Twitter -10%; Q4 2016 results mixed, revenue growth at 1%
    • Earlier (February 9, 2017): Twitter target reduced to $10 at Morgan Stanley
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 26 Comments
  • CDE

    Coeur Mining -21% as Q4 earnings, revenues drop despite record output

    • Coeur Mining (CDE -21.7%) hits lows of the day, now down more than 20% after posting a big Q4 earnings miss and a 10% Q/Q revenue drop even while achieving record production of 3.9M oz. of silver and 102.5K oz. of gold.
    • Free cash flow fell to -$4.5M in Q4 from $14.6M in the previous quarter, hurt by an increase in inventory at the Palmarejo mine caused the timing of a shipment and gold retained for purchase by Franco Nevada related to the mine's transition from a royalty to a streaming agreement.
    • CDE expects Palmarejo to produce 6.5M-7M oz. of silver and 110K-120K oz. of gold for FY 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 15 Comments
  • TSLA

    Tesla roundup: New high for shares, Baird gushes, union woes?

    • Shares of Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) are up 2.77% and etched out a new high of $271.18 earlier.
    • Investors didn't mind the news broke by Reuters that Model 3 test building will begin on February 20. Model 3 production is expected to start later this year.
    • Also in the mix is a positive note out from Baird.
    • "We are buyers ahead of Q4 results. We expect updates on the Model 3 and Gigafactory production ramps on the call, which we believe will drive shares higher," writes analyst Ben Kallo.
    • On a minor side note that could get interesting down the road, a group of workers at Tesla's plant in Fremont have contacted the UAW about setting up an union, according to a post on Medium.com said to be from an employee.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 129 Comments
  • MNI

    McClatchy -4.9%; Q4 ad decline paces revenue drop

    • McClatchy (NYSEMKT:MNI) has legged down 4.9% this afternoon, following Q4 earnings showed revenues that slipped 8.3% but nonetheless edged expectations.
    • Net income came to $3.1M vs. the prior year's $8.8M; per-share amounts were affected by the 1-for-10 reverse split from last June.
    • Revenue breakout: Advertising, $158.4M (down 10.9%); Audience, $92.7M (down 1.9%).
    • For fiscal 2017, it's guiding to a double-digit growth rate for digital-only advertising revenues, along with a continued decline in print ad revenues. Audience revenues are thought to be stable through marketing of product enhancements and pricing programs.
    • McClatchy plans to cut operating expenses and it plans to monetize as many real estate assets as possible, with proceeds going to de-lever the company. Capex is seen at $12M-$15M with no required pension contributions.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • ANTM

    Mulling next HMO targets after Anthem/Cigna blocked

    • With the Anthem (ANTM +2.4%)/Cigna (CI -0.1%) the latest managed care merger to be blocked in court, Leerink's Ana Gupte says Humana (HUM +3.8%) might be a target for either company.
    • If that's not a fit, WellCare  (WCG +1.4%) could be a 2nd option for Cigna, or even Mollina (MOH +2.4%).
    • via Bloomberg
    • Previously: WSJ: Judge blocks Anthem-Cigna deal, likely killing it (Feb. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 4 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: CRAY +18%. NSIT +18%. AVNW +18%. USAT +17%. ZEN +16%.
    • Losers: DNB -17%. TRMR -13%. TWTR -12%. GLUU -11%. LIVE -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • SBGI

    Sinclair Broadcast, Frontier ending TV blackout with new carriage deal

    • Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +3%) and Frontier Communications (FTR -0.9%) have come to a new carriage deal, ending a blackout that started with the new year.

    Take-Two, NBA team up on new 2K e-Sports league

    • Take-Two Interactive (TTWO +2.7%) -- publishers of the long-running NBA 2K basketball videogame series -- is teaming with the pro league on a new e-Sports league.
    • The 50/50 joint venture is the biggest deal yet between digital and physical sports. The NBA 2K eLeague would be the first e-Sports league operated by a major U.S. sports league.
    • NBA franchises will form and run teams competing in the league starting next year.
